results.title: Cognition (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glen Howard, Richard L. Berman, Bay State Film Productions and Harper & Row
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Development of the Child”.
Examines developmental changes in perception, memory, evaluation and reasoning. Includes Piaget’s description of the major stages of development and intelligence and discusses the relevance of attention to detail, recognition and recall memory, conservation of mass and number, and reasoning evaluation.

results.title: Language (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glen Howard, Harper & Row and State Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Development of the Child”.
Examines the child’s language process in the first four years, beginning with the development of phonemes, semantics and syntax. Looks at the process by which language is acquired and how that acquisition can be influenced.

results.title: Landscape
results.creator_credit: Anna Szepesi, Tamas Waliczky and ZKM Institut fur Bildmedien, Karlsruhe
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: In a small German village, time stops in the middle of a storm. Raindrops glitter frozen in the air, and the only living thing is the roving eye of the camera which moves through this frozen moment of time. Using complex digital animation techniques, Tamas Waliczky invites the viewer to reimagine how time and space are perceived and proposes a new virtual experience of the body’s movement through space.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anna Szepesi, Tamas Waliczky and ZKM Institut fur Bildmedien, Karlsruhe

group_siblings.title: Is there any room for me here?

results.title: Is there any room for me here?
results.brief_description: This black-and-white computer animation is based around the image of a sparsely furnished apartment at nighttime, using light and shade effects - of a subtlety and delicacy that recalls the brushstrokes in a Chinese ink drawing - to pick out the objects from the dark background. The austere beauty of the forms and movements is accentuated by the strains of a Bach cello suite.

results.title: Memory of Moholy-Nagy
results.brief_description: An digitally animated journey through the abstract colors, compositions, and constructions of the Hungarian artist Laszlo Moholy-Nagy. Using 3D animation tools, the artist has created a landscape of the mind of this important 20th century artist.

results.title: Human motions
results.brief_description: Around 1987, Waliczky used an ATARI 520 ST to make Human Motions (or, Computer Mobiles) his first-ever animations. In these first seven works, Waliczky explored the possibility offered by the ATARI computer of storing and endlessly repeating a one to four seconds long animated sequence. The seven computer animated sequences are: “WHEEL”, “LOVE TRIANGLE”, CENTRAL SHUTTER”, “BALANCE”, WATERBIRD”, CRYING WOMAN”, “EYE”. The COMPUTER MOBILES address a number of major artistic and technical questions which are characteristic of Waliczky’s oeuvre and crop up repeatedly in subsequent works. Among these issues is the principle of colour animation, i.e., the use of changes in colour to create an impression of movement, as in the two mobiles WATERBIRD and CRYING WOMAN. In BALANCE, one of the most attractive works in the COMPUTER MOBILES series, Waliczky arranged the digitized photographs of a man and a woman into an endless vertical composition. The two figures, captured in acrobatic poses, seem to push and pull one another to and fro, as if engaged in a circus performance watched by the camera as it slowly pans upwards.

results.title: Land of invention
results.brief_description: Famous Scotsmen who have been responsible for many valuable contributions to the machine age include: Macadam, known for “macadamised” roads; Watt, who developed the steam engine; Murdoch, who developed gas-lighting; Masmyth, designer of the steam hammer; Graham Bell, inventor of the telephone; Telford, engineer responsible for the building of the Caledonian canal; and Simpson, who developed chloroform for use as an anaesthetic.

results.title: Land and live in the jungle
results.creator_credit: United States. Army Air Forces. First Motion Picture Unit
results.brief_description: A training film for WWII servicemen showing basic survival techniques for the jungle. Four crash survivors demonstrate how to survive in the jungle by trapping and fishing, cooking and sheltering from the wet. To reinforce the message, a lone airman shows how to do the wrong things. Van Heflin appears as one of the airmen.

results.title: Lady beware
results.creator_credit: Bruce Kerner, Julian Bercovici and Julian Films
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the four basics of personal safety against criminal attack, showing how to secure oneself, avoid danger, knowing when to flee and engage an attacker. Based on the advice of experts in personal safety. Narrated by Shirley Jones.
